conclusion: Analyze motion considering gravitational and air resistance forces to solve for velocity ratio.
Basketball dropped from height H, rebounds to height h; forces are gravity and air resistance.
Basketball initially at rest at height H, falls under gravity and air resistance.
Net downward force is (1 - λ)mg due to gravity and air resistance.
Velocity v at height h is 2√gh using uniformly accelerated motion equation.
Velocity v' at height h is 0 as basketball rebounds to height h.
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is 0/2√gh = 0.
Problem states ratio is same for each collision, given by (1 - λ)/(1 + λ).
Final ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is (1 - λ)/(1 + λ).
